DisCoPy

The Python toolkit for computing with string diagrams

What?

DisCoPy is free software, its source code is open and hosted on GitHub. To learn more, we suggest to start with the documentation.

Why?

Applied category theory is information plumbing. It’s boring… but plumbers save more lives than doctors.

Once string diagrams become as ubiquitous as matrices, they will need their own fundamental package: DisCoPy.

How?

DisCoPy began as an implementation of:

  • DisCoCat (distributional compositional categorical) models,
  • and QNLP (quantum natural language processing).

This application has now been packaged into its own library, lambeq.

Who?

  • Giovanni de Felice (President)
  • Alexis Toumi (Secretary)
  • Richie Yeung (Treasurer)
  • Bob Coecke (Honorary President)

DisCopy is a non-profit organisation registered under the French law of 1901 RNA W751267560, it develops the software of the same name.
